senses.ex: There's a variety of books in the library.

Tips.title: Choice Expansion
Tips.description: Use 'variety' when highlighting the wide range of choices available.
Tips.example: Shopping online provides a wide variety of clothing styles to choose from.

Tips.title: Not Necessarily Many
Tips.description: 'Variety' suggests different types but not always a large quantity.
Tips.example: Despite the small menu, there is a good variety of flavors available.

Tips.title: Avoids Repetition
Tips.description: Use 'variety' to avoid listing all the types, kind of implying 'and so on'.
Tips.example: The festival offered a variety of local dishes.

senses.de: Type or kind within a particular category
senses.ex: He grows several varieties of tomatoes in his garden.

Tips.title: Specific Category
Tips.description: 'Variety' stresses on different subtypes within a specific category.
Tips.example: We tasted a variety of cheeses, from brie to gouda.

Tips.title: Biodiversity Context
Tips.description: In nature-related topics, 'variety' often refers to species of plants and animals.
Tips.example: The nature reserve protects a variety of bird species.

senses.de: A show consisting of multiple different performances
senses.ex: The variety show features comedy, music, and dance acts.

Tips.title: Entertainment Mix
Tips.description: In entertainment, 'variety' signifies an event with multiple act types.
Tips.example: The charity gala hosted a variety performance with magicians and singers.

Tips.title: Historical Entertainment
Tips.description: 'Variety' shows have historical roots, but they still appear on modern TV.
Tips.example: She appeared on a classic variety show that aired in the 1970s.

senses.de: The quality of being different in character or quality
senses.ex: I love the variety in my job, every day is different.

Tips.title: Qualitative Differences
Tips.description: Use 'variety' to indicate qualitative differences, suggesting uniqueness.
Tips.example: The variety of artistic styles makes the exhibit fascinating.

Tips.title: Personal Enrichment
Tips.description: 'Variety' can refer to life experiences that make one's life more interesting.
Tips.example: Adding variety to your daily routine can boost your mood.

Array.wordDefinition:
Both array and variety refer to a collection of things, but they are used in slightly different ways.

Array usually refers to a specific order or arrangement of objects. For example, you might talk about an array of colors in a rainbow, or an array of books on a shelf.

Array is more specific and refers to a specific arrangement, while variety is more general and refers to a group of diverse things.

Assortment.wordDefinition:
Assortment refers to a group of similar items that are presented together in a single set. For example, a store might offer an assortment of different types of candy bars.

So, while assortment refers to the way items are arranged or presented, variety refers to the diversity of the items themselves.

Choice.wordDefinition:
Choice means selecting among different options based on one's preference or decision. For example, when we go to a restaurant, we have the choice of picking from various dishes.

In other words, choice is choosing one specific thing from a group, while variety is referring to the group of things themselves.

Choice is applicable when a person wants to make a decision based on personal preference, and variety is more useful when looking for a broad range of options.

Collection.wordDefinition:
Collection usually refers to a group of similar things, like a set of books, stamps or coins. It suggests that all the items in the group have a common theme, purpose or origin.

For example, a collection of cars might all be vintage models from the 1950s.

A collection is a group of similar things with a common theme, while a variety is a group of different things with some similarities.

Diversity.wordDefinition:
Diversity refers to the existence of different types of people, cultures, or opinions within a group or society. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and respecting differences among individuals to promote inclusivity and equality.

Diversity is applicable when discussing differences among people or cultures in a society, while variety is applicable when discussing the range of options or choices available in a particular situation.

Medley.wordDefinition:
Medley refers to a mixture or combination of different things, often music or foods. It implies that the items blend together, creating a new whole that's greater than the sum of its parts.

A medley might include different types of fruit or a mix of songs.

The main difference between medley and variety is that a medley involves things that are mixed together to create something new, while variety involves diverse things that stand out as individual elements.

Miscellany.wordDefinition:
Miscellany refers to a collection of different things that are not necessarily related, while the word variety refers to a diverse range of similar things.

For example, a miscellany could be a collection of random items such as buttons, stamps and coins.

Miscellany describes a jumbled assortment of things, while variety describes a broad range of similar things.

Multiplicity.wordDefinition:
Multiplicity means a large number or a great amount of something that is the same or similar. Meanwhile, the word variety means a mix or assortment of different types or kinds of things.

For example, if you have a multiplicity of apples, it means you have a lot of apples that are all the same type (like Red Delicious apples).

Multiplicity describes a large number of similar things, while variety describes a mix of different things.

Potpourri.wordDefinition:
Potpourri refers to a mixture of various things, usually with a pleasant fragrance, such as dried flowers, spices, and herbs.

So, while both words refer to a collection of different things, potpourri tends to imply a more random or eclectic mixture, often with a sensory component, while variety refers to a broader range of options within a specific category or type.

Range.wordDefinition:
Range refers to the set of values or items that fall between two limits. For example, the range of temperatures in a given region may be between 0 and 40 degrees Celsius.

In this context, range refers to the extent or span of a particular attribute.

Range refers to the values or extent of a specific attribute, while variety pertains to the number of different types of something.

Range applies to quantitative measurements, while variety is more qualitative in nature.

Selection.wordDefinition:
Selection refers to the act of carefully choosing or picking something from a group of options. It implies a deliberate process of choosing the best or most suitable option out of a limited number of choices.

For example, a store might have a selection of different types of bread to choose from.

Selection is about choosing the best option from a limited group, while variety is about having a wide and diverse range of options available.
